documented that college football games increase assault, vandalism, and disorderly conduct, with effects concentrated on game days and in the immediate vicinity.

Both approaches reach the same qualitative conclusion but through different mechanisms:
: Complementarity discount shrinks → tickets rise to restore markup
: Beer margin collapses → stadium shifts to tickets → attendance falls (limiting beer sales at bad margin)
Stadiums face costs from excessive alcohol consumption that affect their own profits:
: Drunk fans hurt experience for other customers → reduces repeat attendance
: “Cheap beer stadium” image → lowers long-run revenue
Our model shows these internalized costs are
